description: Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) aims to deliver the first two 'improved' Tejas Mark-1A fighters to the IAF next month, pending successful weapon firing trials. Delays are attributed to engine delivery issues from General Electric and weapon integration challenges. The IAF, facing squadron shortages, awaits the delivery of 83 Tejas Mark-1A jets and has ordered 97 more.

title: Desi hypersonic missiles, AI system on defence minister wish list
description: India's defence ministry has unveiled a 15-year technology roadmap, outlining requirements for the domestic industry. The roadmap includes over 200 weapon systems and futuristic technologies, such as hypersonic missiles, stealth drones, and AI-driven systems. The Navy seeks nuclear-powered warships, while the Army needs next-gen tanks. The IAF desires stratospheric airships. This initiative aims to boost self-reliance in defence manufacturing.

title: Firms have to pass on GST cuts, I'll focus on it from September 22: FM
description: FM Nirmala Sitharaman emphasized that companies must pass on GST rate reductions to consumers. Effective September 22, these reforms aim to benefit the common man, farmers, and small businesses. The government is closely monitoring prices and working with industries to ensure full transfer of gains.

title: From Rs 20 to Rs 100: Coconuts turn luxury in India; prices shoot up amid Onam
description: Across South India, coconut prices have surged from Rs 15-25 to Rs 80-100 due to pandemic-induced supply chain disruptions, climate change impacts, and pest infestations. Neglect of plantations, coupled with increased demand during festivals and tourism, has exacerbated the shortage.

The Toronto Argonauts hold his CFL rights, and the UFL could be an option next year if an NFL deal doesn't materialize.

title: PIL challenges minority quota in HC judge selection
description: A PIL has been filed in the Supreme Court challenging the collegium system's practice of considering minority community status when recommending candidates for High Court judgeships. title: Amid a trade war initiated by Trump, a partnership in defense
description: Despite trade tensions initiated by the U.S., India and the U.S. are engaged in Exercise Yudh Abhyas 2025 in Alaska, a large-scale military drill involving 450 Indian Army personnel. The exercise, focused on high-altitude operations and interoperability, underscores the strong defense partnership between the two nations. India emphasizes its commitment to the U.S.

title: Health emergency: 'Mysterious illness' kills 20 in Andhra village; spread via water
description: Andhra Pradesh government addresses a health crisis in Turakapalem. Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu orders a health emergency after numerous deaths. Health camps are planned, and experts will investigate the cause. Protected drinking water will be supplied. A committee is formed to investigate reporting failures. Health Minister Y Satya Kumar Yadav assures action against negligent officials.

The summit occurs amidst US Commerce Secretary's threats of tariffs against India for its Brics participation.

Google and Trump are still in legal discussions over YouTube censorship.

title: Checking blood pressure: Wrong timing may mislead; correct way to do it
description: Blood pressure levels in the body experience natural fluctuations, during different periods of the day. The body experiences natural fluctuations in blood pressure because of its internal cycles, physical activities and environmental elements. The body experiences its lowest blood pressure during rest periods and sleep

title: Meta’s brain drain: Why AI engineers quit; startup CEO cites Zuckerberg’s own words
description: Memories.ai CEO Shawn Shen reveals that Meta's frequent reorganizations are driving AI researchers to seek opportunities elsewhere, including his own startup. Memories.ai is offering lucrative compensation packages, up to $2 million, to attract top talent. The company has already hired a former Meta research scientist as its chief AI officer and plans to expand its AI team significantly.
